category.name: Problem Solving
category.description: Develop analytical thinking and problem-solving skills through algorithmic challenges.

sub_categories.name: Arrays & Strings
sub_categories.description: Master fundamental operations on arrays and string manipulation techniques.

exercises.title: Advanced Array Problems
exercises.description: Solve complex array problems requiring advanced algorithms and optimization.

tasks.title: Dynamic Programming Arrays
tasks.question:
What is the time complexity of the longest increasing subsequence (LIS) problem using dynamic programming?

Consider: Nested loops and state transitions
tasks.hint: Think about the DP table size and filling process
options: O(n log n) - using binary search optimization

tasks.title: Segment Tree Operations
tasks.question:
What is the time complexity of range sum query using a segment tree?

Consider: Tree traversal and node updates
tasks.hint: Think about the height of the segment tree

tasks.title: Fenwick Tree (BIT)
tasks.question:
What is the main advantage of Fenwick Tree over Segment Tree?

Consider: Implementation complexity and memory usage
tasks.hint: Think about code simplicity and space efficiency

exercises.title: Advanced String Problems
exercises.description: Solve complex string problems using advanced algorithms and data structures.

tasks.title: KMP Algorithm
tasks.question:
What is the time complexity of the KMP (Knuth-Morris-Pratt) string matching algorithm?

Consider: Pattern preprocessing and text scanning
tasks.hint: Think about the number of character comparisons
options: O(n + m) - linear time where n is text length, m is pattern length

tasks.title: Suffix Array
tasks.question:
What is the primary use of a suffix array?

Consider: String indexing and pattern matching
tasks.hint: Think about finding all occurrences of a pattern
options: Efficient substring search and pattern matching

tasks.title: Trie Data Structure
tasks.question:
What is the time complexity of inserting a string of length m into a trie?

Consider: Character-by-character insertion
tasks.hint: Think about the number of operations per character
options: O(log m) - logarithmic in string length
